info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 7:50PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Burke, southern Richmond, southwestern Barnwell and southwestern Aiken Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 750 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Waynesboro, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Savannah River Site, Plant Vogtle, Hephzibah, New Ellenton, Jackson, Sardis, Midville, Alexander, Burke County Airport, Gough, McBean, Blythe, Keysville, Girard, Vidette, Savannah River Site Badge Office, Rosier, Di- Lane Wildlife Management Area and Audubon`s Silver Bluff Sanctuary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
